IRS990.MissionDescription: MCI pledges to provide a rigorous, comprehensive educational program to a multicultural student body with a wide range of abilities and interests. In a safe and caring atmosphere, students will acquire knowledge, self-esteem, social responsibility, and the critical thinking and communication skills necessary for global citizenship and lifelong learning.
IRS990.Description: Maine Central Institute offers high school and postgraduate programs in Pittsfield, Maine to Maine School Administrative District #53 (SAD #53) and boarding students. Education and meals provided for aproximately 455 students; housing is provided for aproximately 135 students.

OtherAssets.Description: Cash surrender value of life insurance policies

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: MCI maintains endowment investment funds that are used to fund current/future operations, scholarships, facilities, and to supply capital for other various needs.

IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The school participates in various state governmental Financial Aid programs.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.TypeOfActivitiesConducted: Cost of trips for fundraising and recruiting students.
Cost of trips made to Europe recruiting students.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: All assistance to individuals is in the form of financial aid, grants, scholarships and tuition discounts awarded to students. Assistance is applied directly to the student's account balance.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The Headmaster is required to live on campus, therefore housing is provided at a total estimated fair market value of $17,720. The Headmaster is provided $2,500 annually to purchase financial planning and tax services as needed.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: Pay down existing debt, build a new dining commons, and other renovations.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Wages and payments for activities on behalf of the Organization.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: The organization sells contributions of stock through its investment broker.

For various auctioned items, the organization does not record revenue when items are donated, rather when the items are sold at the auction event. The donor estimated value of auctioned items was $22,103.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy is provided to each member of the board of trustees for review.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Every October, the Organization requires the completion of a conflict of interest disclosure form for any situation that would give rise to a conflict. The Organization maintains records as to who has returned a completed form and the situation in question.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: When determining the compensation levels for the Headmaster of the school, the Organization reviewed documentation from the Independent Schools Association of Northern New England and the National Association of Independent Schools. Salary levels for prior Headmasters, as well as information from other similar schools is also reviewed.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.
The audit process has not changed from prior years.
